TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed HttpRuntime extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a set of ASP.NET run-time services for the current application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpRuntime> object is used at the beginning of the ASP.NET pipeline model that processes HTTP requests. The <xref:System.Web.HttpRuntime.ProcessRequest%2A> method drives all subsequent ASP.NET Web processing.
Page developers can use the <xref:System.Web.HttpRuntime> class properties to find out information about the current application domain for diagnostic purposes, for example. Developers creating custom process pipeline or a custom hosting environment should call the <xref:System.Web.HttpRuntime.ProcessRequest%2A> method from a class derived from the <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest> or <xref:System.Web.Hosting.SimpleWorkerRequest> class.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to get properties of the <xref:System.Web.HttpRuntime> class representing the current application domain and display them to the browser.
[!code-aspx-csharp[SystemWebHttpRuntime#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebHttpRuntime/CS/systemwebhttpruntime.cs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[SystemWebHttpRuntime#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebHttpRuntime/VB/systemwebhttpruntime.vb.aspx#1)]

Docs.related: Page and Application Context in ASP.NET Web Applications

Docs.summary: Gets the application identification of the application domain where the exists.
Docs.value: The application identification of the application domain where the exists.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `AppDomainAppID` uniquely identifies the application. It does not change after the application is restarted and a new application domain is created.

Docs.summary: Gets the domain identification of the application domain where the instance exists.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `AppDomainID` changes whenever the application is restarted and a new application domain is created.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Shuts down the instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is provided for use when your code implements its own hosting environment. There is no need to call this method in the course of normal request processing.

Public Shared Function GetNamedPermissionSet () As NamedPermissionSet

Docs.summary: Returns the set of permissions associated with code groups.
Docs.returns: A object containing the names and descriptions of permissions, or if none exists.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Web.HttpRuntime.GetNamedPermissionSet%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property IISVersion As Version
public: static property Version ^ IISVersion { Version ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the version of IIS that is hosting this application.
Docs.value: The version of IIS that is hosting this application, or if this application is not hosted by IIS.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The version includes major version and minor version; for example, 7.0, 7.5, 8.0, etc.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void ProcessRequest(class System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest wr) cil managed
Public Shared Sub ProcessRequest (wr As HttpWorkerRequest)

Docs.summary: Drives all ASP.NET Web processing execution.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is provided for use when your code implements its own hosting environment. It also can be used to execute child requests when your code implements its own <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest>.

Docs.exception: The Web application is running under IIS 7 in Integrated mode.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property TargetFramework As Version
public: static property Version ^ TargetFramework { Version ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the version of the .NET Framework that the current web application targets.
Docs.value: The version of the .NET Framework that the current web application targets.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is normally set by using the `targetFramework` attribute of the `httpRuntime` element in the Web.config file.
This property is not guaranteed to return a correct value if the current application domain is not an ASP.NET application domain.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void UnloadAppDomain() cil managed

Docs.summary: Terminates the current application. The application restarts the next time a request is received for it.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `UnloadAppDomain` is useful for servers that have a large number of applications that infrequently receive requests. Rather than keep application resources alive for the lifetime of the process, `UnloadAppDomain` allows programmatic shutdown of unused applications.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property UsingIntegratedPipeline As Boolean
public: static property bool UsingIntegratedPipeline { bool get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current application is running in the integrated-pipeline mode of [!INCLUDE[iisver](~/includes/iisver-md.md)].
Docs.value: if the application is running in integrated-pipeline mode; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Integrated-pipeline mode is not available in versions of IIS earlier than [!INCLUDE[iisver](~/includes/iisver-md.md)].
